SENT.plain: A review of the published world experience with heart transplantation for iron overload cardiomyopathy (IOC) between 1967 and 2003 as well as review of unpublished cases from the database of the United Network for Organ Sharing since 1992, identified a total of 16 patients (14 men and 2 women)
IOC etiology was hemochromatosis in 11 patients (69%), thalassemia major in 4 (25%), and Diamond-Blackfan anemia in 1 (6%)
Three patients (19%) died within 1 year of the transplant, all of infectious complications
An additional patient died at 7.14 years (unknown cause)
The actuarial Kaplan-Meier 1-, 3-, and 5-year survival rates were 81% for all 3 time intervals
